title: Activated Spin Resonance with THz Attempt Frequency in SmMn$_2$Ge$_2$
authors: M. L. McLanahan, A. P. Ramirez
abstract:
Relaxation techniques are used commonly to characterize non-equilibrium
phenomena such as freezing in spin glass and domain wall motion in
ferromagnets. Here we investigate the unusual re-entrant ferromagnetic state in
SmMn$_2$Ge$_2$ using ac-susceptibility in the frequency range 0.1 Hz - 1 kHz.
Surprisingly, we find Debye-like relaxation with an energy barrier $E_B \approx
840$ $k_B$ and attempt frequencies in the THz range. We discuss the origin of
this resonance and, in particular, the implication for single-spin resonance of
Sm spins.
